title: Big Nose
synopsis: A lonely circus clown tries to woo a nimble funambulist called Roxanne.

title: Charlie Prince: Rock Idol of the Town
synopsis: Three swallows and a statue of a successful guitarist sacrifice themselves in combatting the poverty in the statue’s city. Based on Oscar Wilde’s short story, “The Happy Prince”.
tags-batch-one: Charlie Prince Rock Idol of the Town

title: The Twelve Days of Christmas
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre, St Thomas of Canterbury Junior School, St Thomas of Canterbury Parish Church Choir, undergraduate carollers, and three professional actors
by-array: St Thomas of Canterbury Junior School
St Thomas of Canterbury Parish Church Choir
synopsis: A university professor conjures up pagan winter festivities in the courtship of his love, backed by a chorus of scholars (including me).

title: Call to Merlin
synopsis: Arthurian legend mingles with the present day.

title: The Invisible Girl
synopsis: An elusive peace-maker re-unites two towns divided by racism.

title: Chester Mystery Plays 2008
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and many other actors and choristers within the CMP cast
synopsis: Quinquennial biblical re-tellings with a community cast.

title: 1001 Nights
synopsis: Scheherazade tells 1001 stories (four of which we performed) to keep a king from killing her.
my-acting-role: a tailor and Sinbad the Sailor

title: The Canterbury Tales
synopsis: A ragtag squad on a pilgrimage to Canterbury compete to tell the most exciting tale (three of which we performed).
my-acting-role: the Nun’s Priest and a pig
example-lyric:
So everybody listen —
Chanticleer’s a divine musician!

title: Noah’s Flood (Chester Mystery Play Reprise 2010)
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and others in the CMP cast
synopsis: Noah follows God’s instruction to save himself, his family, and two of every kind of animal from a catastrophic flood. A reprise of a play from 2008.

title: The Crash of the Rhinos
synopsis: A rhino escapes bullies (and poachers) on the Serengeti to find a new home at Chester Zoo. An original story, part of an extravaganza called Rhino Mania, in which many sculptures of rhinocerotes were displayed around the city of Chester.

title: The Court of King Ludwig
synopsis: A royal wedding is being planned, but the entertainment is locked in the palace dungeon on accusations of trying to feed the bride to a dragon. An original comedy play.
example-lyric:
We hear scurrying rats in the sewers
while we’re worrying about our futures.

title: The Insect Circus
synopsis: A short play about an insect circus. I was involved in four lifts, three of which had me lifting the same small girl.

title: More Than Salt
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and Ista (the International Schools Theatre Association)
synopsis: A king is outraged when, having asked his three daughters how much they love him, he receives the answer “more than salt”. A short fairy-tale devised in one week as part of the Porthleven Youth Theatre Festival in Cornwall.

title: The Snow Queen
synopsis: Adapted from the Hans Christian Anderson story. Performed on Chester’s Eastgate Street in literal snow.

title: Unsinkable
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre, other Theatre in the Quarter actors, and the Hammond School
synopsis: A large-scale collaborative piece with about twenty songs on the story of RMS Titanic.

title: Noah’s Flood (Chester Mystery Play Reprise 2012)
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and others in the CMP cast
synopsis: Noah follows God’s instruction to save himself, his family, and two of every kind of animal from a catastrophic flood. A reprise of a play from 2008.

title: Ghosts of the City
synopsis: In Cestrian history, a Celt tricks a Roman guard, Henrietta the widow waits for her soldier husband in the Civil War, a Victorian bride called Sarah gets jilted by her poker-playing fiancé, and three women are hanged for witchcraft.
example-lyric:
He’s a joker! He’s a knave!
He’s not the ace, he’s one of spades!

title: The Firebird
synopsis: The hungry Firebird keeps raiding a precious apple-tree so Prince Ivan and his brothers are sent to track her down.
example-lyric:
All at once you come across a paradise exquisite —
a glistening golden garden with an apple-tree within it.

title: Masque
synopsis: The Civil War from the perspective of the Cestrian civilian body.

title: The Emperor’s New Clothes
synopsis: A very vain emperor is persuaded to wear clothes that apparently cannot be seen by fools but actually cannot be seen by anyone because they aren’t there.
my-songs-lyricized: No Man or Woman Could Tell Another
My Grandest Garments I Wish to Give
example-lyric:
Good afternoon Your Majesty, we’re humbled to be here,
about to clothe the king of clothes, a fashion pioneer!

title: The Scrapbook
synopsis: Some students and lecturers invent back-stories for strangers in the background of their personal photos.

title: The Strange Adventures of Odysseus
synopsis: Odysseus outsmarts creatures including a one-eyed giant, the mellifluous Sirens, a whirlpool called Charybdis, and his own men in order to get back home after the Sack of Troy.
example-lyric:
You think you can mess with me? How can that be?
I’m tougher than Trojans and oceans of sea!

title: Paintbrush in Paradise
synopsis: A young painter is bullied due to her great imagination so paints a fantastical land where she finds a magical key and rescues her tormentors when they find trouble themselves.

title: City of Stories
synopsis: On Chester’s walls once stood the Northgate Gaol; today we still have the Eastgate Clock, Wishing Steps, Bridgegate, Roodee Cross (sort of), God’s Providence House, and Welshmen who can no more be killed by crossbow at night.

title: Ten Years
synopsis: A concert summarising and celebrating the first ten years of Theatre in the Quarter (founded in 2005).

title: Best Days of our Lives
synopsis: A concert celebrating the Chester suburb of Blacon and its ongoing improvements, particularly in education. All the six schools in Blacon took part, represented by 188 children, as did three professional adult actors.

title: Christmas Day in the Workhouse
synopsis: In a Victorian workhouse such as the one on the Roodee in Chester, destitute and orphaned children were beaten and bullied, underfed and overworked, but there were occasional improvements thanks to do-gooders and benefactors.

title: The Revellers’ Adaptation of Twelfth Night
synopsis: Drunken revellers in the Illyria Arms bring to life Shakespeare’s classic comedy filled with plots, suspicions, courtship, cross-dressing, mistaken identity, and hilarity.
tags-batch-one: The Revellers Adaptation of Twelfth Night

title: The Olympic Torch
synopsis: The Olympic Torch has been stolen, but an aspiring dance-troupe is here to retrieve it in time for the games in Rio.

title: A Handbag of Harmonies
synopsis: A concert by Chester’s best all-female choir, A Handbag of Harmonies, fundraising on behalf of Theatre in the Quarter.

title: Gulliver’s Travels
synopsis: Doctor Lemuel Gulliver escapes his dull, diseased home of early 18th century London and discovers races of pernickety Lilliputians, blazé Brobdingnagians, effusive Laputans, and intellectual Houyhnhnm horses who enslave the human Yahoos.

title: Road to Rio
synopsis: A dance-troupe tries to make itself known at the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

title: The Hills Are Alive
synopsis: Performances by choirs from Canada, the Philippines, Zimbabwe, Chester, and elsewhere in northwest England.

title: Christmas 2016 in the Garden Quarter
synopsis: Events include the switch-on of the Christmas street-lights, a market (which has its own poster), the annual children’s nativity, and church services.

title: The Night Before Christmas
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and Rewind Youth Theatre
synopsis: A toyshop explodes with stories and singing! And a cervid is bullied for his bioluminescent snout so helps a wealthy do-gooder to find needy children and save the cervid’s tormentors when they find a foggy Christmas Eve themselves.

title: Before a Fall
synopsis: Pasiphaë breaks her promise of sacrificing her finest bull every year and Poseidon takes revenge far too far.

title: An Evening with A Handbag of Harmonies
tags-batch-one: An Evening with A Handbag of Harmonies

title: The Promise
synopsis: A city falls into disrepair and discord after a demagogue convinces its citizens to build a wall around it, but a mysterious lady arrives carrying an intriguing package.

title: Swagalicious
synopsis: Statues of a celebrated rock-band come to life in a world of death and poverty.

title: Chester International Music Week
by: various choirs and performers organized by St Mary’s Creative Space
synopsis: Four days of performances from schoolchildren and choirs from Chester, California, China, the Philippines, South Africa, and Zimbabwe.

title: Night of Promises
by: St Thomas of Canterbury Church, Chester
by-array: St Thomas of Canterbury Church, Chester
synopsis: Barn dance and auction of prizes from the community.

title: Christmas Child
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and Rewind Youth Theatre
synopsis: A well-wishing boy and an anonymous girl are each adrift in a world they don’t fit into.

title: A Tale of our Time
synopsis: A creepy, modern retelling of the Prioress’ Tale from Chaucer.

title: The Colour Snatchers & Another Side
by: Jigsaw Music Theatre and Quartz Youth Theatre
synopsis: Four children seek the help of an enchantress and a colour-breathing dragon to save the world from ecological disaster. Then a girl rebels against a totalitarian surveillance state.
example-lyric:
You’re our saviour who imbues
all the world with all its hues.
Music is the fuel you use.
Won’t you help us with our blues?

title: The Colour Snatchers
synopsis: Four children seek the help of an enchantress and a colour-breathing dragon to save the world from ecological disaster.
example-lyric:
You’re our saviour who imbues
all the world with all its hues.
Music is the fuel you use.
Won’t you help us with our blues?

title: Another Side
synopsis: A girl rebels against a totalitarian surveillance state.

title: Blacon’s Mystery Express
synopsis: A train re-unites rival factions by taking them to another world.
